job_Description: Company Description At Fannie Mae, futures are made. The inspiring work we do makes an affordable home a reality and a difference in the lives of Americans. Every day offers compelling opportunities to modernize the nation's housing finance system while being part of an inclusive team using new, emerging technologies. Here, you will help lead our industry forward, enhance your technical expertise, and make your career.   Job Description As a valued colleague on our team, you will work with your team to apply fundamental techniques to support production of insights, new product or change recommendations, process improvement or automation, and predictive modeling. You will apply basic knowledge of data mining and data analysis methods, have familiarity with common large data processing techniques, computational programing capabilities, and practical problem-solving skills, and articulate solutions to non-technical consumers or partners. Additionally, you will work with multiple teams across the enterprise partner with data engineering and data management teams to apply data mining techniques to external or created data sources in preparation for analysis or use of enterprise data assets.   THE IMPACT YOU WILL MAKE The Fair Lending - Data Science - Senior Associate role you will support Fannie Mae's compliance with fair lending laws, as well as the Company's race and equity initiatives. This role will offer you the flexibility to make each day your own, while working alongside people who care so that you can deliver on the following responsibilities: Gather and report on data necessary for fair lending assessments, data availability, and data quality. Provide recommendations regarding modifications to statistical modeling capabilities in an effort to support fair lending objectives. Apply industry practices in research and fair lending testing to model, product, and policy development. Design modeling applications that support fair lending risk identification and measurement. Partner with team to design data visualizations, technical documentation, and non-technical presentation materials to communicate ideas and solutions to business partners. support efficient access to model risk data by leveraging and integrating multiple technology tools Experiences in developing tools to support Model Validation and Review Reports production Desired BitBucket Skilled in Netezza SQL Experience using GitHub Experience using JIRA  Additional Information The future is what you make it to be. At Kensho, we hire talented people and give them the autonomy, support, and resources needed to build cutting edge technology and products for our parent company, S&P Global. We produce a suite of AI-powered solutions that solves the challenges of the largest, most successful businesses and institutions, helping them make sense out of a world full of messy data. We are looking for a Product Manager to work on new product initiatives on our product team. As a Product Manager on Kensho’s transformative technology projects, you will be responsible for taking our machine learning and AI products from ideation to production and into the hands of end users. Our startup culture is focused on making a transformational impact to our customers and thriving in a culture of fast paced development that can take advantage of new opportunities. Are you looking to make impactful, scalable contributions that transform the way we think about data? If so, we would love to help you excel here at Kensho. We take pride in our tightly-knit, team-based community that provides our Kenshins with a collaborative, supportive environment to bring transparency to the biggest challenges in data.  What You'll Do: You will own the product roadmap for your product area, drafting requirements and improvements to help our customers achieve their goals You will work with cross-functional stakeholders across business and engineering to create new products You will define and track appropriate metrics to measure product success You will gain solid technical understanding of our architecture and ability to develop market leading products and services You will deeply understand customer needs/challenges and devise the right solutions You will keep your skills up to date by attending professional development events and learning about best practices in product management  What You'll Need: You have a bachelor’s degree or higher, preferably in a technical field You will ideally have 7+ years of work experience in Product Management at a Technology company (prior experience in an Artificial Intelligence or Machine Learning is a plus) You have experience evaluating, scoping, and presenting product opportunities You have experience developing products to find product-market fit You have familiarity leading complex projects with stakeholders across all-levels and Sorcero, the leader in Language Intelligence, the next-generation of deep learning powered Natural Language Understanding, is immediately hiring a ML Engineer to join the engineering team. Sorcero has been selected by Business Insider as one of the 81 startups expected to boom in 2021, this is an opportunity to engage with high-profile enterprise customers to create something genuinely new and significant.  Why Join Sorcero?  We are making serious strides towards transforming decision-making for key technical industries, like Life Sciences, Healthcare, Insurance, and Engineering, that power the world and you would be a critical part of our success. We have incredible insights into markets and how to build technology that is powerful and differentiated. All while solving huge challenges in people's lives and health that were previously intractable to prior generations of technology. You will help us move even faster.   You'll join a team of brilliant, passionate people working collaboratively to build a sustainable, scalable organization committed to using understanding to create a better world.  You'll be empowered to innovate and apply your intellectual curiosity to interesting technical & business challenges.  You'll actively work to transform an established approach to work and learning with groundbreaking, bleeding edge technology.  You are in the pursuit of mastery and excellence, and are seeking a space and people who share your obsession   Job Opportunity  Sorcero is currently seeking three (3) Machine Learning Engineers specialised in Natural Language Processing and Understanding (or what we like to call an Apprentice NLP Wizard) to help grow our current AI solutions with creative and innovative approaches. You will work with our in-house and contracted platform development team, and work with our technology team to build a ground-breaking knowledge platform. We are looking for an engineer as passionate as we are about building machines that truly understand language and can aid subject matter experts better navigate their workflows.  Not to be negative, but don't waste your time if:   you just want to apply off-the-shelf AI tools to existing data sets;  you've never tried to read the code of an application or library to either (a) fix it or (b) understand how it did something;  you are afraid of the unknown.   Responsibilities  As our ML Engineer, you will be responsible for building end to end ML models, particularly in areas where labelled data is either scarce or non-existing. Out-of-the-box thinking will be required to bring solutions to problems that do not have an established solution. Managing source-code version control discipline (Git) and overseeing code delivery into our projects, testing, and deployment. We are looking for someone with strong engineering discipline and a pragmatic focus on delivering functional code, not allegiance to any one language. We value creativity, the hacker ethos, the near-obsessive focus on building something that will make the future come a bit closer into focus. This role will report to the Lead AI engineer. The ML engineer can be based remotely but will need to work during business hours in US eastern time. We are offering a competitive base salary/benefits package and equity.  Requirements   Have at least three years (two if you don't sleep very much) of recent experience in Python  Have demonstrable experience in all aspects of the ML lifecycle (processing, training, evaluating, deploying, serving, monitoring), preferably in the NLP domain  Are curious and somewhat educated (formally or informally) about cognition and language  Have at least a year's experience with collaborative software development practices (i.e. source control, issues, milestones, code reviews, etc)  Can work (and have worked) late and/or early under the influence of a deadline or inspiration  Can communicate and work well with non-technical or less-technical folks  Can collaborate well with team members who are located across the globe  Aren't afraid of a little math now and then  Have just the right amount of ego   Preferred Qualifications   MSc./PhD in Computer Science, AI or related fields from a top tier university  Expertise in one or more of the following domains: Natural Language Understanding (NLU) and Natural Language Generation (NLG), Graph Algorithms, Machine Learning.  Strong background in developing and deploying ML models (participation in Kaggle competitions is a plus).  Past participation in the technology role in a prior venture-funded startup  Self starter who can be productive from the first day  A sense of humor, and calm under pressure   About Sorcero  Understanding is the key to intelligence. With this principle at heart, we leverage Language Intelligence to give our customers fluid and fluent access to and control over the inherent complexities of their businesses. At Sorcero, we believe in augmenting human beings, not replacing them. Our platform gently directs users towards the right answer, and always supports human experts.  Because  (human + AI) > human or AI alone  Sorcero is an Equal Opportunity Employer dedicated to the goal of building a culturally diverse environment, and strongly encourages applications from diverse candidates.

Data Scientist Gaithersburg, MD At Miltenyi Biotec, 3,000 employees worldwide develop pioneering solutions for biomedical science and the clinical application of cell therapies. On our Process Development team, we work to ensure that lentiviral vectors for multiple therapeutic indications can be produced in a scalable, serum-free suspension production system. This, coupled with our expansion into our new facility gives us the opportunity to grow our team with talented process development professionals. Among other responsibilities, you will work cross-functionally in a matrix environment between Process and Analytical Development, Manufacturing, Quality, and CMC Project Management to support method and process validation by applying statistical principles and techniques that provide solutions to a wide range of challenges in the gene therapy commercialization environment. Additional responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following: Provide statistical expertise to project teams on the development and implementation of proper study design, statistical analysis, and data interpretation Routinely utilize JMP Statistics software for the setup and analysis of Design of Experiment (DoE) based studies resulting in robust design space transfer functions Perform data analysis including, but not limited to, Distribution Analysis, Statistical Tolerance, Capability Analysis, Model determination, Curve fitting, Simulations, and Edge-of-Failure analysis Generate and analyze control charts as part of periodic trend analysis and develop statistical reports with data interpretation Write and implement use of JMP Scripts for increased accuracy of routine data analysis Prepare technical writing in support of CMC documentation Requirements Bachelor's or Master's Degree with at least 3 years’ experience in biopharmaceutical industry with technical knowledge in specifications, stability, and biopharma commercial manufacturing processes; or an equivalent combination of education or experience Minimum of two years' experience demonstrated statistical data analysis expertise in support of biologics process characterization and validation Solid understanding in experimental design, statistical methodologies, modeling and simulations Excellent interpersonal skills, especially when communicating statistical concepts to non-statisticians, and ability to train colleagues to perform basic functions within JMP Understanding of common analytical methods used in Biotechnology labs (Immunoassays, PCR, Cell based titer, Flow Cytometry, HPLC, etc. Subject-Matter-Expert with SAS JMP Statistical Analysis and DOE software Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. job_title: Social Science Research & Data Analytics Fellow
job_Description: New America is a think tank and civic enterprise dedicated to renewing the promise of America by continuing the quest to realize our nation’s highest ideals, honestly confronting the challenges caused by rapid technological and social change and seizing the opportunities those changes create. From our founding in 1999, New America has been building a different kind of think tank: one dedicated to public problem solving. Our talented team is more than just policy specialists— we’re visionary researchers, changemakers, technologists, and storytellers who understand the challenges and opportunities presented by dramatic social and technological change. The Future Frontlines program is a public intelligence service for next generation security and democratic resilience. Nested within New America’s International Security Program, Future Frontlines focuses on novel security threats posed by technological disruption and the resulting radical redistribution of global power among states, and transnational, cross-sectoral networks. The program’s mission is to leverage open source data and tools to generate fresh, policy relevant insights into how emerging technologies are changing the character of conflict, political violence, governance and statecraft. A core goal of Future Frontlines is to train a diverse new generation of unconventional journalists, technologists, and human rights defenders to use datasets to change mindsets. About the position: The Social Science & Data Analytics Fellow will help advance the goals of the Future Frontlines program by conducting research and activities in support of program projects. The Fellow will serve as a key member of the research team we have assembled to support the launch of the Jan.6 Research Consortium, an interdisciplinary working group of academics and practitioners focused on investigating the circumstances leading up to and surrounding the violent breach of the Capitol during the 2020 presidential election on Jan.6, 2021. In addition to the monthly fellowship stipend, all fellows and research support staff will receive intensive training in open source investigation techniques and tools, and gain unprecedented exposure to some of the leading researchers in machine learning and big data analysis. The fellowship also provides opportunities to publish original research and to network with media and university partners. The position requires strong analytical and organizational skills and an appetite for solving complex puzzles about the relationship between online and offline social behaviors. The position requires strong data analysis and data visualization skills, superior command of the English language, and solid interpersonal skills. Strong preference will be given to candidates from diverse backgrounds with demonstrated interest in international affairs, political science, investigative journalism, sociology, and/or anthropology. This part-time position is ideal for a graduate student entering the final year of their studies, a recent graduate of a social science or journalism Master’s or PhD program, or an early career working professional interested in gaining real world experience in producing policy relevant research in the national security sphere. Duties & Responsibilities Collect, collage, and analyze large amounts of data Develop data driven research and data visualization products that explain complex topics to a wide audience Manage project data flows and maintain data documentation to support project coordination Collaborate across organizations to coordinate the translation of data driven research into written publications, briefings, and presentations Qualifications: A bachelor’s degree (required), graduate degree (desired) in the fields of journalism, sociology, anthropology, public policy, political science, international relations, data science, information science or technology policy Two years prior experience in a related field preferred Comfortable with a high degree of autonomy and a small team environment Ability to handle multiple projects and deadlines while maintaining a high level of work quality Excellent writing and communication skills, with an emphasis on concise writing for a diverse lay audience Ability to discern patterns from large data sets and communicate the “big picture” through data visualizations and written products that concisely convey nuance and relevance Experience with data set summarization using basic summary statistics and social network analysis Collaborative team player with a willingness and curiosity to delve deeply into various policy topics Keen eye for new opportunities to advance our work; knowledge of how to balance limited resources to ensure their greatest effect High level of flexibility and creativity with the ability to solve problems and identify creative approaches to challenges Skilled in Python and/or R, and basic familiarity with data visualization software such as matplotlib/ggplot, Datawrapper, and/or Tableau as well as basic command of MS Office/Google Apps are a must Experience implementing web-based data exploration tools is a plus Previous experience working in a newsroom, technology or a start-up environment is a plus Candidates with a degree of language proficiency in Russian are also encouraged to apply Application Process: To apply, please submit a resume and cover letter, and two (2) writing samples.  We will consider applications on a rolling basis. New America is an equal opportunity employer committed to hiring a diverse workforce at all levels of the organization thereby creating a culture that allows us to better serve our clientele, our employees, and our communities. We value and encourage the contributions of our employees and strive to create an environment where everyone can reach their full potential and drive outstanding results. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, age, sex, religion, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, gender identity or expression, or any other basis protected by local, state, or federal law. This policy applies with regard to all aspects of one’s employment, including hiring, transfer, promotion, compensation, eligibility for benefits, and termination.  NruWCQUJIQ

Title: Bioinformatics III - Data Scientist Location: Silver Spring, MD FLSA Status: Exempt Travel: No Position Summary: BACKGROUND The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) is responsible for protecting the public health by assuring the safety, efficacy, and security of human and veterinary drugs, biological products, medical devices, our nation's food supply, cosmetics, and products that emit radiation. The FDA is also responsible for advancing the public health by helping to speed innovations that make medicines and foods more effective, safer, and more affordable, and helping the public get the accurate, science-based information they need to use medicines and foods to improve their health. The mission of the Center for Devices and Radiological Health (CDRH) is to protect and promote the public health. CDRH assure that patients and providers have timely and continued access to safe, effective, and high-quality medical devices and safe radiation-emitting products. We provide consumers, patients, their caregivers, and providers with understandable and accessible science-based information about the products we oversee. We facilitate medical device innovation by advancing regulatory science, providing industry with predictable, consistent, transparent, and efficient regulatory pathways, and assuring consumer confidence in devices marketed in the U.S. CDRH's Office of Product Evaluation and Quality (OPEQ) leads CDRH's premarket review process of medical devices marketed in the U.S. OPEQ plans, conducts and coordinates Center actions regarding approval, denial, and withdrawal of approval of Premarket approval applications (PMAs), product development protocols (POPs) and investigational device exemptions (IDEs); makes substantially equivalent determinations for premarket notification submissions 510(k)s; and monitors sponsors conformance with requirements of all programs. OPEQ also coordinates Center classification activities, reviews petitions for, or initiates reclassification of medical devices, provides executive secretariat and other technical support to medical device advisory panels, and conducts continuing review, surveillance, and medical evaluation of the labeling, clinical experience, and required reports submitted by sponsors of approved applications. The Office of Regulatory Programs (ORP) in OPEQ is seeking the services of an experienced data scientist. This data scientist shall conduct analyses to support managerial decision making and enhance understanding of the medical device premarket review programs of the OPEQ in the CDRH. SCOPE The candidate shall serve as a data scientist, responsible for ongoing, independent, and active analytical skills in the development of performance measures, quantitative methods, and models. This individual shall analyze data using statistical approaches such as linear progression, classification, sampling methods, and/or subset selection. This individual must demonstrate expertise utilizing a variety of data analytic tools to analyze interpret unique and highly specialized datasets, in premarket data system used by OPEQ. The data scientist will evaluate data warehousing strategies to meet the needs of ORP. They will be skilled at synthesizing data and performing all phases of a systems development required for the design, development, and implementation of features enabling data access to draw conclusions and/or make predictions based on data summaries or statistical analyses. Duties/Responsibilities: Utilize a variety of data analytic tools to analyze and interpret unique and highly specialized datasets; Solve complex analytical problems using quantitative approaches; Communicate data findings to stakeholders using different visual formats to picture and provide reports; and Provide technical expertise to product teams in the development, implementation and oversight of new technologies related to data science. Apply quantitative methods to summarize data and identify trends, correlations, relationships, means, medians, percentiles, ranges, distributions, and outliers. Communicate issues, analyses, findings, conclusions, and recommendations both orally and in writing. Minimum Requirements: BA/BS and 6 years' experience or MS and 2-years' experience This individual must demonstrate expertise in SAP BusinessObjects for data reporting and sharing and is proficient in writing code utilizing VBA, SQL database code, MATLAB and/or Python and utilizing visualization tools such as Tableau, PowerBI to convey statistical or technical information. Shall collaborate with other scientists and professionals, such as business analysts, to recommend solutions to meet business requirements. Must exhibit mastery of the English language, both orally and in writing. Requires expert knowledge and skill with PC-based Microsoft software, specifically Outlook, Word, Visio, Excel, and PowerPoint. Apply online at our website: https://kikiktagruk.applicantpool.com/ Disclaimer:  This is not to be an exclusive list of all responsibilities', duties, and skills required of the person in this job. KIC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. KIC considers all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, religion, age, physical or mental disability, family responsibility, marital status, sexual orientation, political affiliation, veteran's status or any other legal protected status. Pursuant to The Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act 43 U.S.C. Sec. 1601 et seq., and federal contractual requirements, Kikiktagruk Inupiat Corporation, may legally grant certain preference in employment opportunities to KIC Shareholders and their Descendants. EOE/AA/M/F/D/V. Please view Equal Employment Opportunity Posters provided by OFCCP here. Successful candidate must pass, comply and adhere to KIC's Drug and Alcohol policy/testing requirements and pass a thorough background check including fingerprinting.

Are you looking to join a highly ambitious media analytics & software startup? Do you want to bring a groundbreaking product to market?  Cross Screen Media was founded by industry veterans and gives customers a new way to plan and execute video advertising campaigns by using a common currency for TV and digital. To achieve this, we need to build an amazing team. Here's where you come in…  We are looking to hire a Principal Data Scientist to support the ScreenSolve product strategy. The successful candidate will employ skills and experience to improve, create, and innovate using data and complex analytics to solve current business problems, while anticipating and charting future research needs. An integral component of the role is research and prototyping, incorporating foundational research and collaboration with ongoing initiatives within Cross Screen Media. There are computational elements as well, where candidates will have the opportunity to develop, design, prototype, and lead the implementations of new machine learning algorithms for large data sets.  Through thoughtful planning and purposeful analytics, we anticipate customer needs and enable our clients to connect with their audience in meaningful, targeted ways. We expect all data science team members to be hands-on with respect to the analysis of our data, using the full suite of Cross Screen Media's technical tools to create timely, relevant, and actionable insights.  Key Responsibilities  Leveraging machine learning to solve non-convex / combinatorial optimization problems. Lead and contribute to data analyses and modeling projects from project inception. Participate in business review meetings with internal and external stakeholders to determine requirements and deliverables, reception, and data processing. Set priorities for and lead analyses, preparing final reports and presentations, communicating results, and implementing support. Leverage advanced statistical techniques to create high-performing predictive models and creative analyses to address business objectives. Research conference materials, books, journals, and publications to identify and implement cutting edge methodologies supported by current literature. Lead the deployment of analytical solutions in production systems. Communicate with internal stakeholders concerning product design, data specification, and model implementation. Create project plans and timelines to ensure projects are completed on time with expected deliverables.  Experience  PhD or MS with 5+ years of experience Degree in machine learning, computer science/engineering, applied mathematics, statistics, or related quantitative fields. Strong understanding of numerical optimization methods. Extensive experience in machine learning / deep learning, reinforcement learning, representation learning, RNN, CNN, GNN, etc. Extensive experience in Python (and PySpark) as well as experience using modern machine learning / deep learning tools, such as scikit-learn, Tensorflow or Pytorch. Knowledge of distributed and cloud platforms, AWS preferred. Nice to have: Peer reviewed publications in the area of machine learning. Publications in the area of degree demonstrating record of problem solving are also acceptable.  What We Offer  This role offers a 100% remote work option Competitive salary with high bonus potential Collaborative and creative atmosphere, with inspired leadership Career advancement opportunities Recognition and reward for outstanding performance Great medical, dental & vision Insurance packages Competitive 401K with company match to plan for the long term Unlimited paid-time-off Transportation benefits & cell phone reimbursement Casual dress all day, every day   Unfortunately we are not able to sponsor visas for this position.

We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package including health, dental and vision insurance, 401K with a company match, commuter benefits, flexible spending accounts, paid holidays, paid time off and more. Kingstonville is seeking a Data Scientist to join a team. This candidate will be a part of a team communicators supporting Heliospheric missions and science at our client's site in Washington DC. These missions include Solar Orbiter and Parker Solar Probe which provide discoveries of what is happening with our sun and the Heliospheric environment. The team communicates NASA science through web posts, social media, video production and podcasts. Team members have a goal of expanding the reach of science communication to broad audiences including secondary schools, Hispanic communities, the public as well as providing information to scientists and experts. The successful candidate will work remotely temporarily but will be required to work at the client site once it fully reopens. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Serve as a support scientist, for example, specify data product metadata. Compile, analyze and provide various metrics (ingest, archive, distribution and user) to ESDIS Project, NASA HQ, and instrument teams. Perform special and anomalous metrics analyses/studies Work as a substitute Interface Manager for EOS instrument science teams attend bi-weekly telecons as needed, prepare/distribute meeting minutes Develop interface requirements documents for processing of instrument data. Provide system engineering support for development of programs to support data analysis and reporting. Support development and host functions for conducting seminars using internet-based tools, such as webinars. Support organizing end user workshops and participation in the various conferences in the communication capacity as required. QUALIFICATIONS Proficiency in remotely sensed Earth Science products from the various instruments onboard the NASA/NOAA satellites, Including EOS Terra, Aqua, Aura, NPP. Experience conducting meetings, interfacing with technical groups, such as Science Team Members, and developing technical materials, such as Interface Control Documents. Familiarity with the airborne data, e.g. ICEBridge, EV-1 Experience in system software development, preferably EOSDIS components Experience in querying Oracle databases using SQL Experience in MS office S/W (Excel, Word, Power Point) Excellent communication (written & oral), and teamwork skills US Citizenship or Permanent Residency Required. At least Master’s degree in physical sciences At least 5 years of experience in earth sciences including remote sensing of geophysical parameters At least 3 years of experience in system software development Solid knowledge of remotely sensed Earth data products and data processing particularly those from NASA Earth Observing System (EOS) instruments Excellent communication (written & oral), and teamwork skills' 'Work Location:  One location Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) Health insurance Paid time off Schedule: Monday to Friday Ability to commute/relocate: Greenbelt, MD 20770: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred) Application Question(s): What are your salary requirement? Why Join Rincon Research Corporation (RRC)? At Rincon Research Corporation, our primary business is innovating, developing, and fielding digital signal processing (DSP) products and services for the United States Defense and Intelligence Communities in support of national security. Rincon Research Corporation (RRC), an employee owned company, is seeking a talented, tenacious, results-driven individual with experience in developing Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML) algorithms. This is an opportunity to pioneer novel AI/ML approaches to interesting challenges in a multi-disciplinary R&D environment with likeminded, motivated engineering staff who are collectively responsible for creating innovative solutions in support of national security and defense. Come join the team that is creating cutting edge signal processing, geolocation, and communication systems for the future! What are the primary responsibilities in the Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning Engineer position? Under general supervision, this individual will work on small project teams to conceive, analyze, design, implement, test, deploy, and maintain Radio Frequency (RF) and Machine Vision systems. The right candidate will be expected to demonstrate creativity and disciplined work habits leading to solutions that are innovative and well justified. What required background will make you successful? Bachelor’s degree in one of the following disciplines: Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or other equivalent fields of discipline. Highly motivated to learn new ML/AI algorithms and to maintain familiarity with the latest advances in the field. Strong scientific reasoning ability. 5 or more years demonstrated experience with Statistical Machine Learning methods such as Bayesian Inference, Clustering, Regression, etc. 4 or more years of experience with Convolutional Neural Networks for object detection/classification for images. Proficiency with at least one high-level deep learning software library (TensorFlow/Keras, PyTorch, MXNet, etc.). Ability to obtain and maintain a Top Secret/SCI security clearance. US Citizenship Required. Preferred skills: Master’s or PhD in one of the following disciplines: Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Applied Mathematics, or other equivalent fields of discipline. Familiarity with a broad range of AI/ML topics such as Deep Reinforcement Learning, Adversarial/Counter-Adversarial AI, Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), and Transformer models. Experience in scientific programming with C, C++, or similar language on UNIX/Linux. Digital Signal Processing (DSP) experience. Active TS/SCI clearance. Where is the position located? This position is located at our Tucson, AZ office. What benefits does RRC offer? 100% employer-paid premiums for family medical and dental insurance, employee life insurance, short-term and long-term disability (STD & LTD) Flexible reimbursement spending accounts for medical expense and dependent care Immediate participation and vesting in the company’s Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) and 401(k) Plan Employer contributions to RRC’s ESOP Employer matching contributions to the company’s 401( k) Plan Employer discretionary contributions to the company’s 401(k) Plan Rincon Research Corporation is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor.

Riverside Research is seeking a Data Modeler to support the development of a Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA) transitional modernized database for foundational military intelligence (FMI). The Data Modeler will work as part of an integrated team consisting of ISR mission subject matter experts, database developers, data scientists, and application testers to create and implement a comprehensive, scalable, flexible, and rigorous artificial intelligence/machine learning (AI/ML)-ready analytic data environment. The Data Modeler will be responsible for creating conceptual, logical, and physical data models based upon data requirements captured thru iterative engagements with DIA and other intelligence community (IC) analysts. This position requires occasional travel to gain an understanding of customer challenges and the complex environment in which they operate.  All Riverside Research opportunities require U.S. Citizenship.  Job Responsibilities:   Works with Mission and MIDB production SMEs to analyze, discover, define and document current MIDB databases' data structures organized around objects that relate to the infrastructure mission.  Redesigns the data model using requirements and guidance provided by the Government and migrating the data into the new data models.  Applies Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML models) to identify data values from disparate source systems that are null or incorrect.  Understand and translate business needs into data models supporting long-term solutions for relational and object-oriented databases.  Work with database team to implement data strategies, build data flows and develop conceptual data models.  Create logical and physical data models using best practices to ensure high data quality and reduced redundancy.  Optimize/update logical and physical data models to support the new requirements.  Maintain conceptual, logical and physical data models along with corresponding metadata.  Create data cataloging capabilities  Develop best practices for standard naming conventions and coding practices to ensure consistency of data models.  Recommend opportunities for reuse of data models in new environments. Perform reverse engineering of physical data models from databases and SQL scripts.  Evaluate data models and physical databases for variances and discrepancies. Validate business data objects for accuracy and completeness.  Analyze data-related system integration challenges and propose appropriate solutions.  Develop data models according to best practices.   Minimum Qualifications:   TS/SCI Clearance required (ability to obtain CI Poly).  Bachelors degree.  2-5 years of experience in data modeling principles/methods including conceptual, logical & physical Data Models.   Desired Qualifications:   TS/SCI with CI Poly preferred.  Prior experience with PostgreSQL  Knowledge/experience with Data Modeler Tools such as Erwin, ER/Studio, or any native DB modeling tools SQL DB Diagrams, MySQL Workbench, etc.  Knowledge of metadata management, data modeling, and related tools (Erwin or ER Studio, or others).  Riverside Research strives to be one of America's premier providers of independent, trusted technical and scientific expertise. We continue to add experienced and technically astute staff who are highly motivated to help our DoD and Intelligence Community (IC) customers deliver world class programs. As a not-for-profit, technology-oriented defense company, we believe service to customers and support of our staff is our mission. Our goal is to serve as a destination company by providing an industry-leading, positive, and rewarding employee experience for all who join us. We aspire to be a valued partner to our customers and to earn their trust through our unwavering commitment to achieve timely, innovative, cost-effective and mission-focused solutions.  Riverside Research remains committed to the safety of our employees and customers. Under Executive Order 14042, effective January 4, 2022, all Riverside Research employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. Fully vaccinated means at least two weeks after the final shot in the required timing and dosage. Riverside Research will grant reasonable accommodation to those where a medical or religious exemption has been approved by the company. Newly hired employees must be fully vaccinated by January 4, 2022, unless an approved accommodation has been granted by Riverside Research. All new hires starting after January 4, 2022 must be fully vaccinated by their start date.  All positions at Riverside Research are subject to background investigations. Employment is contingent upon successful completion of a background investigation including criminal history and identity check.  Our EEO Policy Riverside Research is an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, employ, train, compensate and promote without regard to race, religion, sex, color, national origin, age, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, disability/veteran, status as a protected veteran, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state and local law.  If you need assistance at any time in our application or interview process, please contact Human Resources at  +91-XXXXXXXXXX  or email HR@RiversideResearch.org. A member of the HR team will be available to assist.  This contractor and subcontractor shall abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-741.5(a). Description: The Lockheed Martin Artificial Intelligence Center (LAIC) team is seeking a high energy AI Software Systems Architect with a strong background in engineering, architectures, engineering, and systems to support the factory optimization and computational engineering portfolio for the business. In this role you will be part of the an advanced manufacturing and analytics team consisting of colleagues possessing varying skill sets including; front-end and back-end developers, engineers, specialists, product managers, and other scientists. The selected candidate will focus on the computational engineering portfolio but will be included as part of a broader range of projects across the LAIC portfolio. The team is focused on innovation teams that rapidly iterate and mature solutions from prototypes to deployment for utilization across the enterprise.  The AI Software Systems Architect works closely with customers defining requirements and developing system architectures for solving complex business problems aimed at optimizing business performance. The chosen candidate will be engaged in the technical execution of software and algorithm development activities across the full life cycle, including requirements generation, system and design, implementation, integration and test while ensuring the appropriate standards, processes, procedures, and tools are applied on assigned programs. The candidate will possess a passion for conceptualizing, building, testing and maturing and digital systems. This candidate will apply technical standards, principles, theories, concepts, and techniques in the field to tangible, differentiated and meaningful solutions aimed at significantly enhancing business performance and enabling future capabilities.  The selected candidate will lead a range of projects including short-term sprints (rapid prototyping) and long-term engagements (integration, maturation of prototypes). The individual will be responsible for leading sprints, providing technical mentoring, making innovative contributions to the of new business opportunities, product line road maps, and supporting new business captures. The candidate must exhibit self-motivation, a strong work ethic, time and interpersonal skills.   Possible hiring bonus depending on skills and experience  Must be a US Citizen Basic Qualifications:  Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, from an accredited college in a related discipline, or equivalent experience, with 9 years of professional experience; or 7 years of professional experience with a related Master’s degree Proven leadership experience in engineering assignments and successful proven results in leading and executing on intensive programs Proven experience leading virtual teams Proven experience developing requirements and architectures for deployed systems Strong and proven understanding of the engineering process Familiarity with one or more of the disciplines (e.g. Natural Language Processing, Anomaly Detection, Markov Chain and Monte Carlo (MCMC) Methods, Predictive, Statistical Analysis and Hypothesis Testing)  Strong working knowledge of basic statistical concepts such as point estimation, probability distributions, hypothesis tests, and how they can be applied Ability to multi-task Excellent communication skills Experience implementing algorithms Knowledge of frameworks (Pytorch, Tensorflow, MxNet, Caffe, etc.) Experience with multiple languages, both traditional compiled (C/C++/Ada/) and interpreted (/Typescript) Experience with of large-scale distributed application (traditional client/server, Service Oriented Architectures, Microservice Architectures, etc.) Basic understanding of web application using C#, VB.Net, .Net Core, Angular, and SQL Server. Experience with DevOps tools: Docker, Git [GitLab, GitHub], Continuous Integration [CI], Continuous Deployment [CD] Must be a US Citizen Desired Skills:  Experience developing prototype Background in high-performance computing (), embedded HPC a plus Experience with DevOps tools: Docker, Git [GitLab, GitHub], Continuous Integration [CI], Continuous Deployment [CD] Experience interfacing with databases (SQL, MongoDB, etc.) Lean Six Sigma (Green Belt or Black Belt Certification) Operations Background Familiarity with services Track record of being a strong independent contributor Lean Six Sigma (Green Belt or Black Belt Certification) Operations Background Ability to build strong relationships with stakeholders, customers, colleagues, and suppliers and to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner  Experience programming in R, , SQL, C++, C#, BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications   Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Overview: Overview: In this role, you will use code and approved tools to import, synthesize, and analyze data to research and forecast issues and opportunities for our government clients to help them improve the efficiency and effectiveness of their processes and programs. Your contributions will make an impact on the critical missions of our government clients, solving challenges that aim to improve millions of lives across the globe. Responsibilities: Responsibilities: As a Senior Data Analyst, you will: Perform advanced analytics, data and model validation, and quality assurance while working as full-time on-site staff at the customer or employer facility. Research, assess, and report the analytic impact of the customers’ business processes, data dependencies, or standards implementation across various internal customer systems. Extract, synthesize, and analyze data from internal customer systems to provide data management design and development recommendations. Champion the use of, recommend, lead knowledge sharing sessions, or train in advanced analytics best practices and integration to improve customer data literacy. Create or revise metrics to assess program, project, data use, or data flow effectiveness. Research data to identify and provide root cause analysis reports of prioritized issues; provide data or business rules guidance to correct data quality issues; or make recommendations to improve performance or use of data. Develop procedures and automated workflows to import/export data and integrate analytics or related process improvements per oversight, technical, and business specifications. Work closely with stakeholders to clarify business requests, understand database relationships, extract data, conduct and validate analysis, obtain customer feedback, and present preliminary or final results appropriate for the intended audience. Assess the feasibility of and prioritize business requests, communicating status and risk with the project manager on a routine schedule. Analyze and translate functional specifications into technical specifications for each analytic workflow step, including an estimated level of effort, projecting hours to complete the request, designating milestones and due dates within project timeframes and meeting those as appropriate. Write and maintain clear and concise documentation within approved documentation repositories allowing stakeholders to understand goals, operational steps, data dictionaries and business glossaries, data flows, or preservation plans, as applicable. Perform quality assurance or peer review for junior team members or technical teams, as needed. Other similar professional duties may be assigned as needed. Qualifications: Qualifications: 7 to 10 years of professional and proven experience in a related role. Demonstrated customer focus, initiative, and problem-solving for each analytic workflow step. Expertise in conducting and driving adoption and integration of basic to advanced data analytics: descriptive, diagnostic, predictive (natural language processing, data and text mining, pattern matching, cluster analysis, sentiment analysis, etc.). Proficiency in MS SharePoint (data import/export, integration) and Excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, other advanced functions). Expertise using R or Python AND SQL to query, synthesize, and analyze data with integration and data use adoption in other tools or applications (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, SharePoint). Proficiency with facilitating or presenting, to include knowledge sharing sessions. Practical experience using advanced analytics to optimize one or more of the following areas is strongly preferred: data domains; data ownership or stewardship; metadata management; master data management; business processes; data quality; data architecture, data access. Domain knowledge in Emergency Management, DHS, or FEMA is strongly preferred. Knowledge of how best to visually display advanced analytics (data and text mining, pattern matching, natural language processing, cluster analysis, sentiment analysis, etc.) is strongly preferred. Knowledge in data science (i.e., exploratory process to discover unknown patterns and correlations or identify questions/scope) is preferred Education Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, and Statistics, Healthcare Analytics or related field is required. Employer will accept a suitable combination of education, training or experience Work Authorization: US citizenship required in order to obtain a US government Public Trust Clearance About REI: Employees voted REI Systems a Washington Post Top Workplace in 2015, 2016, 2018, and 2020! REI Systems has delivered innovative solutions that empower people and impact millions of lives since 1989. Our customers include healthcare, national security, science and technology, and government operations in the federal, state, local, and non-profit sectors. We take a Mindful Modernization® approach in providing Application Modernization, Government Data Analytics, Grants Management Systems, Saas, and Advisory Services. Delivering domain expertise, best-fit technologies through agile execution, and a commitment to customer service is the REI Way. Learn more, visit www.reisystems.com. Data Background - TS/SCI Required  Position Description CGI Federal is currently seeking highly skilled and experienced professionals interested in contributing their expertise to a brand new, cutting edge project within the Intel Community. We are currently seeking all experienced professionals with a background as a Data Modeler, Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or Data Quality Analyst. If interested, please apply today!  Functional Role: Data Modeler  Duties: Works with Mission and MIDB production SMEs to analyze, discover, define and document current MIDB databases' data structures organized around objects that relate to the Infrastructure mission. Redesigns the data model using requirements and guidance provided by the Government and migrating the data into the new data models. Applies Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML models) to identify data values from disparate source systems that are null or incorrect. Develops conceptual, logical and physical data models. Understand and translate business needs into data models supporting long-term solutions for relational and object oriented databases. Work with database team to implement data strategies, build data flows and develop conceptual data models. Create logical and physical data models using best practices to ensure high data quality and reduced redundancy. Optimize/update logical and physical data models to support the new requirements. Maintain conceptual, logical and physical data models along with corresponding metadata. Create data cataloging capabilities Develop best practices for standard naming conventions and coding practices to ensure consistency of data models. Recommend opportunities for reuse of data models in new environments. Perform reverse engineering of physical data models from databases and SQL scripts. Evaluate data models and physical databases for variances and discrepancies. Validate business data objects for accuracy and completeness. Prior experience with PostgeSQL is preferred Data Modeler Tools: erwin, ER/Studio, or any native DB modeling tools SQL DB Diagrams, MySQL Workbench etc.  Degree: Bachelors Experience: 2-5 years experience in data modeling principles/methods including conceptual, logical & physical Data Models. Desired: Knowledge of metadata management, data modeling, and related tools (Erwin or ER Studio or others). Functional Role: Data Analyst - Senior  Duties: Develops automated data decomposition algorithms and/or scripts that analyze data attributes to determine if more specific, operationally relevant relationships can be captured via data decomposition into separate parts such as detailing the day of the week as a separate, categorical value from the date and incorporate the results into business rules or a data model as appropriate. Gathers data requirements, data rules, and understands relationships between data feeds. Degree: Bachelors Experience: 7-10 years experience in data management, creating, maintaining, and updating data records contained in the data catalog. Certifications: Oracle Certified Developer, Microsoft Certified Professional Developer, Security +, Oracle Database 12 Administrator Certified Professional, Certified Scrum Master, Cognos Certified Professional Functional Role: Data Analyst - Junior  Duties: Develops automated data decomposition algorithms and/or scripts that analyze data attributes to determine if more specific, operationally relevant relationships can be captured via data decomposition into separate parts such as detailing the day of the week as a separate, categorical value from the date and incorporate the results into business rules or a data model as appropriate. Gathers data requirements, data rules, and understands relationships between data feeds. Degree: Bachelors Experience: 1-2+ years experience in data management, creating, maintaining, and updating data records contained in the data catalog. Functional Role: Data Scientist - Senior  Duties: Works in cross-functional engineering and product development teams with data at all stages of the analysis lifecycle to derive actionable insight. Utilizes data to provide innovative technologies that enable the integration of FMI tools and data, improve data ingestion, increase data scaling, and enhance data exploitation to ensure more interoperable and secure data. Assists in identifying and developing new and innovative data models (conceptual, logical, physical) and data relationships; support development of automated data cleaning algorithms and automated rescaling algorithms. Has the ability to apply supervised and unsupervised machine learning algorithms for clustering, classification, and dimensionality reduction. Degree: Bachelors Experience: 5-8 years experience obtaining data from multiple, disparate data sources including structured, semi-structured and unstructured data. Desired: Experience with using the Joint Enterprise Modeling and Analytics (JEMA) framework or Apache NiFi to develop data processing workflows. Knowledge of commercial Cloud services used by the IC. Functional Role: Data Quality Analyst  Duties: Responsible for working across the scrum teams to validate quality-related outputs and establishing metrics for data quality. Supports the development of automated data cleaning algorithms and automated rescaling algorithms. Develops and documents the innovative methodologies in order to improve data quality prior to its transition to the transition MIDB database: Develops a Data Quality Assurance Plan that documents deficiencies in data quality, sources of those deficiencies, potential mitigations, and constraints associated with those mitigations, and includes benchmarks for data quality. Develops the capability to monitor and report data quality benchmarks. Degree: Bachelors Experience: 1-8 years experience in industry accepted tools, standards and methodologies in mathematics and statistics to determine both data quality strategies and analysis. Desired: Strong SQL, data mapping, and data profiling skills. Your future duties and responsibilities  Required qualifications to be successful in this role Per Federal Stipulations, TS/SCI Clearance required, with ability to obtain CI Poly. TS/SCI with CI Poly preferred.  #CGIFederalJob   Build your career with us.  It is an extraordinary time to be in business. job_title: Senior Data Analyst II - Civic Tech
job_Description: The Company:   BlueLabs is a leading provider of analytics services and technology for a variety of industry clients: including government, business, and political campaigns. We help our clients optimize their engagements with individual customers, supporters, and stakeholders to achieve their goals. Simply put: we help our partners do the most good by getting the most from their data.   Today, our team of data analysts, scientists, engineers, and strategists come together from diverse backgrounds to share a passion for using data to solve the world’s greatest social and analytical challenges. We’ve served more than 400 organizations ranging from government agencies, advocacy groups, unions, political campaigns, international groups, and companies. Along the way, we’ve developed some of the most innovative tools available in analytics, media optimization, reporting, and influencer outreach- serving a diverse set of industries, including the automotive, travel, consumer packaged goods, entertainment, healthcare, media, telecom, and more.   The Team:   The BlueLabs Government Analytics practice revolutionizes the way government agencies use data to streamline operations, interact with citizens, and react to their biggest challenges. Our team develops deep expertise within the areas our clients care about most, then builds data analytics systems that create impact at scale. We work closely with internal government innovation groups, and build on the analytics methodology pioneered in e-commerce, advocacy, politics, and consumer finance. You will work on a fast-paced, impact-driven project team charged with intelligently improving the operations powering the policies and programs that hundreds of millions of Americans interact with on a daily basis. Our work builds the frameworks and infrastructure that allows agencies to deal with big public health challenges. We bring definition to challenging problems, creatively identify data sources, then design analytics that accurately measure impact and move the needle every day. We work in changing, ambiguous environments, so we embrace nuance, inclusivity, and complexity to deliver programs that work for the diverse groups of individuals who rely on us.   Who You Are:  You have a proven track record using data-driven solutions to improve social outcomes - and bring a multidisciplinary approach to doing so.  You apply variety of skills: whether thinking strategically about how to develop an enduring process, digging deep into a complex data analysis, or putting yourself in the shoes of an end-user to answer a question they didn’t know they had - you’re comfortable thinking from a number of different perspectives  You are able to anticipate questions from your stakeholders while remaining objective in how you approach their unique challenges. You are experienced deriving value from imperfect data, but also know when to pull the emergency stop button.   We’re not building a team for a day—this is a project for the long haul. More than anything else, we’re looking for people who are excited by our mission, love to create, are honest about what they know, fascinated by what they don’t, and relish the opportunity to work with people who value the same. In this position you will:  Conduct and supervise analysis on data from disparate data sources to distill human-centered operations and processes into meaningful insights or evaluate and improve the effectiveness of large-scale healthcare related directly addressable (email, SMS, autodial, etc) outreach campaigns.  Drive data analysis and data management strategies to create systematic methods of measuring performance across complex systems and technical implementations.  Develop KPIs and metrics that address root problems and develop compelling visualizations to allow clients to easily understand challenges and take a clear action.  Check, clean and transform incoming data for data pipelines, and help others to do the same.  Collaborate with engineers, data scientists, program managers and external stakeholders to troubleshoot problems and proactively create solutions.  Strive to support team excellence by developing high quality documentation.  Work both independently and as part of a team to deliver accurate products on short deadlines.   You probably have:  Advanced understanding of how to manipulate data using SQL or Python.  Significant proficiency in one or more general or statistical programming languages (i.e. Python, Ruby or R) to systematically solve problems, and interest in learning new tools and techniques.  Significant experience creating repeatable data transformation processes.  Experience going from insight to impact: using the results of your analysis to tell a story through visualization, presentation, and writing.  3-4+ years of work experience working with structured/unstructured data.   You may also have experience:  Leading a project in which you (and possibly also your team) led a client from the point of analysis to change in behavior - whether internal or external to the organization.  Helping more junior analysts take their work from 80% to done: maybe by quality checking results, adding context, or helping to organize raw analysis into stories and recommendations.  Experience developing solutions that blend data-driven decision-making with thoughtful understanding of human-centered design/processes.  Authoring narrative and data visualizations that were tailored to engage your client at the right level of detail.  Guiding significant aspects of larger projects that aim to achieve key objectives, using your strong understanding of the organization’s end goal and with minimal direct supervision.  An undergraduate degree in a quantitative field or equivalent technical training.   This position requires that you successfully attain and maintain a Federal Public Trust background investigation that our government clients require. This includes a requirement that the individual has US Citizenship or US residency for three of the past five years. The salary for this position is $85,000 annually. BlueLabs offers a friendly work environment and competitive benefits package including premier health insurance plan, 401K matching, unlimited vacation, 14+ weeks paid parental leave, professional development & learning stipend, flexible working hours, telecommuting options, pre-tax transportation options and more!   At BlueLabs, we celebrate, support and thrive on differences. Not only do they benefit our services, products, and community, but most importantly, they are to the benefit of our team. Qualified people of all races, ethnicities, ages, sex, genders, sexual orientations, national origins, gender identities, marital status, religions, veterans statuses, and disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply. As an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer, BlueLabs is committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

About the Team  STR’s Analytics division researches and develops advanced analytics and machine learning-based solutions to solve challenging problems related to national security. Our projects span multiple different data modalities and incorporate advanced algorithms, deep learning, and statistical techniques to uncover patterns in social media, structured and unstructured text, time series, geospatial, and imagery data. The tools and technologies we develop have real world impact and are used by analysts to extract and enrich intelligence information around the globe.  The Role  As a  Machine Learning Engineer – Data Science , you will develop, implement, and evaluate statistical machine learning algorithms to uncover hidden information and patterns from a diverse collection of massive datasets. You will apply state of the art and novel techniques such as supervised and unsupervised learning, machine learning, and deep learning to problems such as classification, anomaly detection, and forecasting. You will develop cutting edge systems and work collaboratively with our software engineers to design and deploy models into production. You will interact with customers to understand requirements and apply iterative feedback to development. This position is based in office and applicants should expect to primarily work onsite. Requirements In response to Executive Order 14042 and accompanying Task Force Guidance, all STR employees must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 by December 8, 2021, unless a medical or religious accommodation is formally approved by STR. Who You Are  Experience with multiple regression and classification techniques such as Support Vector Machines, Random Forests, Naïve Bayes Classifiers, and Deep Neural Networks  Experience in data grooming and handling large, messy or incomplete datasets  Experience with particle swarm optimization, behavioral modeling techniques, Data assignment, and multi-hypothesis tracking  Degree in some examples include a scientific field such as Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Data Science, or Physics  Understanding of and experience with statistical and machine learning techniques  Proficiency with a one or more programming language such as Python, MATLAB, Java, or C++  Previous experience (internships and academic work included) working with complex datasets and building statistical, machine learning, or deep learning models  Motivated collaborator who’s comfortable communicating to both technical and non-technical audiences  Currently holds a top secret security clearance or better  Even Better  MS or PhD in a scientific field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Physics  Track record of developing, implementing, and evaluating statistical algorithms against real datasets  Specialized expertise in a data-rich field such as time-series analysis, graph analytics, geospatial analysis, image processing, or Bayesian programming  Experience with one or more deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch or Tensorflow  Experience working with large datasets and familiarity with big data infrastructure, such as AWS, Hadoop, Spark, Dask, or MapReduce  Active TS or TS/SCI security clearance  Systems & Technology Research (STR) is a rapidly growing technology company with locations north of Boston, MA, Arlington, VA and near Dayton, OH. We specialize in advanced research and development for defense, intelligence, and national security, trying to understand how to protect our society: from stopping malicious botnet attacks, to understanding cyber vulnerabilities, providing next generation sensors, radar, sonar, communications, and electronic warfare to developing artificial intelligence algorithms and analytics to make sense of the complexity that is exploding around us. STR is committed to creating a collaborative learning environment that supports deep technical understanding and recognizes the contributions and achievements of all team members. Our work is challenging, but you go home at night knowing that you pushed the forefront of technology and made the world a little safer. We recognize that the world is changing, that it is becoming more connected than ever before, making things change faster than before, and reshaping society in the process. We all want to understand this changing world and leave it better for our work. We're not just any company. Our people, culture, and attitude along with their unique set of skills, experiences, and perspectives put us on a trajectory to change the world. We can't do it alone, though - we need fellow trailblazers. If you are one, join our team and help to keep our society safe! STR is an equal opportunity employer. We are fully dedicated to hiring the most qualified candidate regardless of race, color, religion, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation and pregnancy), marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any portion of the employment process, email us at appassist@stresearch.com and provide your name, phone number and email address. Pursuant to applicable federal law and regulations, positions at STR require employees to obtain national security clearances and satisfy the requirements for compliance with export control and other applicable laws

job_title: Artificial Intelligence Architect, Manager - Applied Artificial Intelligence
job_Description: Limited immigration sponsorship may be available. The team  Analytics & Cognitive In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence, embracing decision making with clear, data-driven choices that deliver enterprise value in a dynamic business environment.  The Analytics & Cognitive team leverages the power of data, analytics, robotics, science and cognitive technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform decision-making. Overview: LMI is a consultancy dedicated to powering a future-ready, high-performing government, drawing from expertise in digital and analytic solutions, logistics, and management advisory services. Work in a fast-paced, solutions-oriented environment focused on client deliverables, analysis, and reporting. job_title: Data Scientist / Power Platform Developer, Mid-level - FAA
job_Description: Position:  Data Scientist / Power Platform Developer, Mid-level - FAA   Function:  Data Science   Location:  Remote   Remote Work Option:  Yes   Culture Cobec is consistently breaking the current mold for delivering services to our government clients. What does that mean? That means believing in a “people first” mentality, building high performance teams and empowering people to make informed decisions without going through a large bureaucratic system. Cobec values the well-being of employees and bestows tremendous trust in those people to negotiate work and non-work obligations. Cobec is where someone can bring their whole self to work and be themselves, never having to compromise their authenticity just to fit in. Lastly, we believe in the work we do, the goals and missions of our customers and the interpersonal relationships we have with clients, stakeholders and our people.   Values and Expectations The successful candidate for this role embodies the same values as Cobec. We realize experience is important, however; Cobec believes a person’s abilities and skills that align with our values (Relationships, Leadership, Passion, Accountability, Integrity, Innovation, Quality, Teamwork, Diversity, Commitment, & Respect) are the most important drivers for success in this role.  In addition to exhibiting our values, a successful candidate for this role is expected to be a high performer, organized, dynamic, and have a positive attitude.   Job Summary   This position will apply advanced analytical and mathematical techniques to solve complex decision problems. Candidate will use high performance computing, big data analytics and data visualization tools and techniques to assist in making acquisition decision and to maximize operational effectiveness and efficiency.   Years of Relevant Experience   The position requires 2 - 7 equivalent years of experience in operations research, modeling and simulation, or technical analysis. Specific experience with the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) or the Aviation Industry is desired.   Essential Job Functions    Individual will support model and simulation development to provide quantitative analyses, cost-benefit and economic analyses to support the Federal Aviation Administration Program Acquisition and Operational Systems Evaluation.  Individual will have experience in data collection, data normalization techniques, statistical analysis, performance metrics development and tracking and other mathematical/operations research techniques and methods.  Individuals will also support process and policy improvement for operations research and modeling guidelines, including research and assessment of operations research tools.  Individuals will be required to contribute effectively to working groups through oral and written communication and cooperative working relationships  Individuals will support the develop of custom visualizations   Education Requirements  Bachelor’s degree required, preferably in Engineering, Mathematics, Operations Research, Physics, Economics, or similar.   Master’s degree is a plus   Skills Requirements   2+ years of experience with Microsoft Power Platform based development and in the use of Microsoft 365 components, including SharePoint, Teams and Power Automate, including Power Apps and Power Automate  2+ years of experience with development using one of the following two design patterns, including Canvas App with Power Automate and SharePoint Online List or Microsoft List or Power Portal with Model Driven App and Dataverse  3+ years of experience with conducting and participating in design reviews and code reviews  3+ years of experience with developing and reviewing SDLC work products and artifacts  Experience with using Agile development methods and processes  Ability to analyze time and effort estimation of design and development work to support sprint planning  Experience with SQL/Database Management is desired  Experience with MATLAB, SAS, Python, Java/C++/VBA and MS Office Products is desired  Experience with and data visualization tools such Shiny, Tableau, Cold Fusion is desired   Security Requirements  Must be a US citizen or a legal resident for three of the past five years  Must meet eligibility requirements for a US Public Trust security clearance   Travel  Occasional travel required as needed by client/s and/or company   EEO  Cobec Consulting, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, state and local law.  EEO is the Law

job_title: Senior Research Scientist – Machine Learning: Signals and Language
job_Description: Overview  The  Data Science Team  applies expertise in machine learning, data visualization, statistics, and computational architectures to solve hard research challenges in AI security & privacy, synthetic biology, cyber security, computational social science, code analysis, biometrics, and other areas. We have built systems that summarize source code, predict protein stability, visualize complex networks with millions of nodes, and detect stealthy denial-of-service attacks. Our team values creativity, initiative, collaboration, and diversity. We strive for a fun and collegial atmosphere that encourages intellectual cross-pollination and professional growth. We are passionate about empowering our customers' missions and enjoy working together at the leading edge of technology! You will develop, apply, and evaluate state-of-the-art acoustic, signal processing, and natural language processing techniques to solve complex cyber problems. You will work collaboratively on a multidisciplinary team alongside experts in cybersecurity, machine learning, and software development with clients that include DARPA and other government agencies. You may also contribute to technical proposals in new research areas.
